intro: Cochlearia glastifolia var. megalosperma, commonly known as the giant-seeded rock白菜, is a flowering plant native to the British Isles. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are basal, rosette-like, and often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. The variant megalosperma is distinguished by its larger, more robust seeds compared to the typical form.
